website_summaries.verdict: This Merrell backpacking boot received loads of praises for its comfort and lightweight design. The gear’s durability and traction also obtained good feedback from the outdoor community. However, there were those who found this model a bit warm. Overall, the Merrell Phaserbound 2 Tall Waterproof hits the mark for backpackers who are looking for performance on wet trails.
pros: Numerous buyers are impressed by the comfort offered by the Merrell Phaserbound 2 Tall Waterproof
Its lightness is commended by the majority
A bunch of consumers is pleased with the sturdy build of this footgear
This Merrell product delivers ample underfoot support over uneven terrain, according to several purchasers
It provides sufficient protection from wet trail conditions, as testified by a couple of adventurers
Several hikers say that the boot’s Vibram outsole grips well on challenging ground conditions
It virtually has no break-in time, notes a few outdoor lovers
cons: The Merrell Phaserbound 2 Tall Waterproof can get warm during a hike, according to the minority

customer_reviews.title: Well made, comfortable boots
customer_reviews.text: I wear these boots on average approx. 4 hrs per day 7 days per week. I get about 6 months out of a pair, before they start breaking down. I think I am on my 12th pair of Merrells. The model names change a little, but they are pretty much the same. Phaser Peak then Phaser Bound. They are super comfortable and give great support.
customer_reviews.author: BM

customer_reviews.title: Excellent boots.
customer_reviews.text: My third pair in five years. Comfortable and super support around the ankle area. Retired and do a lot of hiking in the mountains.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Lancaster

customer_reviews.title: If you are truly looking for waterproof then look elsewhere then Merrill.
customer_reviews.text: After five weeks they are leaking and are not waterproof. This has happened before...The replacement boots that Merrill provided leaked in the first wet weather hike. This company is playing a numbers game hoping that people don’t where there be long enough to find out that they’re not waterproof. Again, if you want a waterproof boot don’t buy Merrill.
customer_reviews.author: Cruiserbruiser

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable hiking boot
customer_reviews.text: Great and comfortable fit. Been wearing the last few months. Hiked about 50 miles so far and seem pretty good. Wore on a bighorn sheep hunt in rocky terrain and boots were great. Rubber toe protector on one boot glued and staring to come off so only 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Fishsqueezer102

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable boots for wide feet.
customer_reviews.text: I like the boot, haven't had any issues yet with them getting wet like others have had. I have only put about 20 miles on them so far and they are holding up fine. They are comfortable on my feet and I have a very wide toe box.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Fit as expected. Very satisfied!
customer_reviews.text: I've telling wearing these Merrill boots for years. Love these boots!
customer_reviews.author: Martha Nicholson

customer_reviews.title: great hiking boot
customer_reviews.text: I have owned many different brands and levels of hiking boots over the years, on my second pair of these and they are my new favorite.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Russo

customer_reviews.title: Good boot!
customer_reviews.text: I have been hiking with this boot model for about ten years. I understand Merrell is discontinuing Phaserbound, so I snapped up a pair! Good shelf to trail design, however I feel they have cheapened the insoles with this pair. I would recommend a pair of Superfeet insoles.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Bauer

customer_reviews.title: Warm and dry boots
customer_reviews.text: Warmest boots I have ever worn in the snow. I’m from AZ so I’m a wimp with snow. These boots kept me warm and dry. Good job Columbia!!
customer_reviews.author: AZMustang

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I'm on my second pair in two months First pair, insole failed, sent back and got another pair. Same with new boots. Had a pair a year ago and they were great. Guess quality went out.
customer_reviews.author: Robbie Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: Comfort !
customer_reviews.text: The most comfortable out of the box boot you could hope for . . and at this price it's gotta be a best buy !
customer_reviews.author: gerald murphy

customer_reviews.title: Not deserving of “Phaser” in the name
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had four pair of Merrell “Phasers” over the past 20 years. It’s been my go to boot for scrambling and peak bagging but these are nowhere near the same as the previous versions. Not nearly as rugged material nor as supportive of the ankles. I sent them back and will have to look at other brands going forward. Major disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: montanadave

customer_reviews.title: great shoes
customer_reviews.text: I wear these shoes everyday at work. I'm a surveyor.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly Mason

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of these boots. First pair lasted two years. I use them as a work/ hiking boots. Very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Frymire

customer_reviews.title: Amazing boot
customer_reviews.text: Just amazing boots. I had a pair of teva boots that were my favorite hiking and working boots. They finally were to the point i had to get another pair. But they no longer make them. Went to bass pro and tried countless pair of different boots on and then I finally found these. Even better than my tevas and hopefully they won’t stop making these. Or i might just buy a couple more pairs and keep them for later use. Its hard to find such a great boot.
customer_reviews.author: Charp dawg

customer_reviews.title: Mandatory 5-star rating after first day
customer_reviews.text: I have worn these more since, but the very first day I wore them I stepped into a 3" deep slush puddle (yes, in June!). There was no wetness at all. Too many boots these days (including my other Merrells) claim to be waterproof but are actually hydrophilic. I was on a rescue call miles off-road, so I was very happy to be warm and dry on the way home. Since that day, these boots have been completely comfortable and not too hot in the 80 degree days that followed. Living in the mountains, I wear boots every day and they get a lot of challenges. So far these are great. Note: Bought directly from Merrell, but used AmazonPay.
customer_reviews.author: Jemez Fred

customer_reviews.title: Old Faithfuls
customer_reviews.text: Had these through a majority of my college years and still rocking them. Very durable, non slip (even on quite a few slippery waterfall hikes), and I’ve never noticed any issues with waterproofing. I’m not exactly wading through creeks in them, but I’ve definitely been hopping through puddles on the AT. Good arch support, hardy laces.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

product_meta.title: Merrell Men's Phaserbound 2 Tall Wp Walking Shoe
product_meta.description: This durable leather backpacking boot will protect your feet during long hikes with heavy packs.
feature_bullets: Waterproof membrane seals out water and lets moisture escape
Kinetic Fit BASE removable contoured insole for flexible support
Merrell Air Cushion in the heel absorbs shock and adds stability
Lightweight EVA foam midsole for stability and comfort
Vibram MegaGrip for the best combination of traction and durability on wet or dry surfaces
